coveo:metadata.description: Data security is no longer a checkbox in the IT or operations departments, but is a top business priority for most enterprises. As compliance requirements like HIPAA and PCI-DSS continue to expand in scope, and as unstructured data?often sensitive information relating to customers and corporate IP?proliferates inside an organization, the requirements and restrictions on data and data access have come under increased scrutiny. This need for heightened security comes at a time when organizations are finding real business value in platforms like Apache Hadoop for delivering more data across the enterprise. Cloudera Enterprise (powered by Hadoop) is a single, unified solution that lets you store and analyze all your data and metadata, while providing compliance-ready security and governance, and end-to-end system management.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop Data Protection

coveo:metadata.description: The Enterprise Data Hub Accelerator helps organizations execute their first Big Data projects quickly and effectively by providing a clear and complete roadmap on how to scale the data platform, governance, and analytics. This roadmap becomes part of a full enterprise-wide Big Data strategy to aid business transformation.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera & Capgemini: EDH Accelerator Data Sheet

coveo:metadata.description: Data Optimization for the Enterprise is a service offering that helps organizations achieve significant additional value from their data in return for a relatively low capital investment. Clients can take full advantage of Cloudera?s big data technology to optimize the ratio between the value of data and its storage costs, while also gaining extended capabilities to handle complex data. Cloudera?s expertise in optimizing existing Data Warehouse architectures using Hadoop complements Capgemini?s broader view of these analytical landscapes, from the variety of source systems (internal or external) to the interfaces (business applications) that expose the data in the form of practical insights for your business users.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera & Capgemini: Data Optimization Data Sheet

coveo:metadata.description: Insurers have long struggled with data silos. Getting the right information at the right time is a challenge. Cloudera provides a new paradigm for breaking data silos. For the first time, insurers can blend and analyze data from any source, in any amount and for all types of workloads. The Insurance industry is undergoing a digital transformation, in which big data, machine learning and IoT are playing a central role.
coveo:metadata.title: Transforming Life Insurance with Big Data and Machine Learning

coveo:metadata.description: The Cloudera Data Science Workbench (CDSW) is an enterprise data science platform that accelerates data science and machine learning projects by providing a robust yet familiar environment for model building with self-service access to data wherever it?s stored. With a complete solution for data exploration, analysis, visualization, modeling and model deployment, CDSW makes secure, collaborative data science at scale a reality for the enterprise, accelerating the delivery of new data products and unifying IT, data science, developers, analysts and business stakeholders across the data science workflow.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Data Science Workbench

coveo:metadata.description: Organizations today are leveraging data to drive more efficient processes and more effective outcomes. The highest value use cases rely on a variety of data analysis capabilities working in concert, yet this can be hard to achieve in a fragmented IT ecosystem. In a hybrid and multi-cloud world, organizations need data context - a single, consistent way to manage and maintain data access and governance policies across all users, analytics and deployments. A critical part of Cloudera Data Platform (CDP), SDX (Shared Data Experience) is Cloudera's integrated set of security and governance technologies built on metadata and delivering consistent context across all analytics and public as well as private clouds.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera SDX: Delivering consistent data context for hybrid and multi-cloud

coveo:metadata.description: Available through monthly on-site engagements supplemented with remote advising hours, Resident Data Scientists apply Cloudera Fast Forward Labs? industry-leading expertise to guide your enterprise ML journey, speeding time to results and adding value as an embedded member of your team.

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Fast Forward Labs works with a wide range of customers at different points in their data journey. Strategic engagements ideally occur at a regular cadence, along with monthly advising time, to continue to guide customers along their journey as they learn and grow. Outlined below are a few typical stages at which we recommend strategic engagements. In each of these, we have the unique advantage of having access to experts within Cloudera to make concrete recommendations for data storage or migration that lay the necessary foundation for future machine learning work.

coveo:metadata.description: As the implantable device industry continues to grow, it's essential that medical device manufacturers more fully grasp the detailed data chain of custody surrounding their business processes, tracking precisely how data is captured, used, and secured over the data lifecycle. In doing so, manufacturers can better protect patient privacy and reduce product liability risks. This informational one-pager outlines the importance of establishing a data chain of custody, specifically focusing on data security and compliance and product traceability, and how Cloudera can help manufacturers achieve it.
coveo:metadata.title: Strengthening Compliance and Mitigating Liability for Medical Device Manufacturers

coveo:metadata.description: Healthcare is evolving toward care delivery that rewards improved patient outcomes while reducing costs and eliminating waste and abuse throughout the care journey. This has created a massive data convergence requiring organizations to quickly and securely turn data insights into action. The Cloudera Data Platform, including the Shared Data Experience (SDX) drives data optimization from the bedside through complex machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI), delivering actionable intelligence back to the point of care. Read this Datasheet to understand how to drive better health outcomes with Cloudera.

coveo:metadata.description: A time series data warehouse provides the ability to report and analyze data at regular intervals, from sources like sensors, devices, IoT entities, and financial markets. In this document, we will share how these enterprises utilize the same platform and data warehousing technology for high scale, time series applications, based on Cloudera HDP 3.

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera DataFlow (CDF) is a comprehensive edge-to-cloud real-time streaming data platform that collects, curates, and analyzes data so customers gain key insights for immediate actionable intelligence. It meets the challenges faced with data-in-motion, such as real-time stream processing, streaming analytics, data provenance, and data ingestion from IoT devices and other sources. Built on 100% open source technology, CDF supports secure and governed data ingestion, data transformation and content routing. CDF helps you deliver a better customer experience, boost your operational efficiency and stay ahead of the competition across all your strategic digital initiatives.

coveo:metadata.description: Businesses have access to more data now than at any time in recorded history. Companies today must adjust to meet the new strains and demands big data places on them. And they must begin to do so now, as big data is going to grow and become more integral to success in the next decade. According to IDC, the amount of data generated will be in excess of 44 zettabytes by 2020. With that type of growth, businesses that are not evaluating their current data architecture risk being overwhelmed by the volume and speed of data. Even worse is being left behind by competitors who are better equipped to use data as a way of driving decision-making. The term big data is misleading?there?s more to this phenomenon than size alone. In addition to unprecedented data volumes, organizations now face a range of new data types and a pace of data creation they often aren?t prepared to handle. Big data is highly complex and differentiated; it originates from a variety of sources. Yet at the same time, big data also encompasses traditional structured financial, operational, and customer data. It turns out the ideal solution for big data is one built on multiple components, allowing the enterprise to turn big data hype into productive solutions fit to their specific needs. The logical data warehouse is a dramatic expansion of the prior blueprint for a data warehouse. Together, Teradata and Cloudera are championing the rapid expansion of data warehouse concepts into a fresh, new way of delivering analytic value to the business.
coveo:metadata.title: Unifying the Enterprise Data Hub and the Integrated Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: Rapid growth of the digital ecosystem continues to challenge an organization?s ability to balance the introduction of new technology for data management methods and leveraging existing infrastructure effectively. The concept of big data is changing the conversation on how organizations will manage the variety, velocity, and volumes of data (the 3 Vs). Moreover, it?s forcing technologists and business leaders to infuse agility into data modernization initiatives in order to identify opportunities to exploit data better, improve analytic capability and remove cost while remaining focused on the strategic business objectives.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera & Capgemini: Embracing the "New Normal" of Big Data Whitepaper

coveo:metadata.description: This white paper will equip your team with options for starting your Hadoop journey, outline benefits of Hadoop, and highlight many use cases for this new approach to managing, storing, and processing big data.

coveo:metadata.title: Dell, Intel, and Cloudera Handle Hadoop Together

coveo:metadata.description: Digital transformation is disrupting traditional citizen and student service delivery models. coveo:metadata.description: An insurer?s business depends on accurately assessing and mitigating risks of all types. coveo:metadata.description: Cybersecurity has become the topic of conversation for organizations across every industry. With the average breach costing $200 per lost customer record, and even more for lost intellectual property, organizations are looking for new solutions. Forward-thinking organizations have discovered a new class of solutions that can detect sophisticated, novel threats designed to look like typical behavior. That is why organizations are turning to Cloudera?s enterprise data hub, powered by Apache Hadoop, to modernize their cybersecurity architecture, detect advanced threats faster, and accelerate threat mitigation.
coveo:metadata.title: Three Reasons to Modernize Your Cybersecurity Architecture

coveo:metadata.title: DBTA Cybersecurity Sourcebook 2017

coveo:metadata.description:
After dialogue and debate for much of this decade, the European Parliament approved the General Data Protection Regulation (the ?GDPR?) in April 2016. Given this is a Regulation (rather than a Directive), this legislation will apply automatically in every EU country beginning on May 25th, 2018. Many of the requirements are similar to those set out in Directive 95/46/EC (the ?EU Directive?); however there are several expanded requirements as well as dramatically increased consequences for non-compliance.

For the majority of organizations, GDPR compliance is an enterprise-wide business problem ? a massive cross-departmental effort that impacts oversight, technology, processes and people. This document highlights Cloudera?s capabilities which may be useful as part of the technology portion of an organization?s overall preparations for GDPR.

For specific GDPR questions, please refer them to GDPR@cloudera.com
coveo:metadata.title: Simplify Your Response to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)

coveo:metadata.description: Powered by sensors, connectivity and smart machines, the Internet of Things (IoT) is reshaping the manufacturing and industrial processes, effectively changing the paradigm from ?repair and replace? to more of ?predict and prevent?. By capturing and utilizing data streaming from sensors and connected devices, businesses can now gain visibility into the condition of their valuable assets and specific components in real time. Utilizing IoT and sensor data from connected equipment, organizations can effectively predict when and how an asset might fail, detect variances, understand warning signals, and quickly identify any patterns that might indicate a potential breakdown. Data-centric organizations are using advanced analytics and machine learning to detect anomalies or patterns that are indicative of failure and intervene as soon as initial signs of failure are detected to perform the right maintenance activities. Download this paper to learn more about how today's enterprises can effectively ingest, process and analyze petabytes of data generated from IoT in order to effectively drive predictive maintenance. Learn more about IoT customer use cases across different verticals, that highlights how some of the leading organizations are utilizing Cloudera and the power of IoT and advanced analytics to drive predictive maintenance.
coveo:metadata.title: Driving Predictive Maintenance in a Connected World

coveo:metadata.keywords: Public Sector,Whitepapers,Documents,Public Sector,Internet of Things,Machine Learning,Whitepapers
coveo:metadata.description: Whether a consumer, a business, or a government organization, we use images and videos to capture and create a record of events about the world around us. We share that data to communicate in a manner that is often more efficient than the spoken or written word. Cloudera, piXlogic, and Intel have partnered to make advanced image and video analytics available to big data customers. The piXlogic software provides a scalable set of ?extra eyes? that can automatically go through images and videos stored in Hadoop clusters and generate metadata describing their contents. This enables search, content discovery, alerting, and integration with other analytical tools in the Cloudera stack. Customer environments where images and videos are a critical component of the workflow will benefit greatly from these expanded capabilities.
coveo:metadata.title: Working With Images and Videos at Scale: Solutions for Law Enforcement

coveo:metadata.keywords: Whitepapers,Documents,Cloudera Data Science Workbench,Machine Learning,Data Science,Whitepapers

coveo:metadata.description: As companies scramble to protect digital assets from a new generation of threat actors, big data and machine learning are yielding critical threat intelligence. A new IDG Research survey finds greater visibility is essential.

coveo:metadata.description:
In the wake of the global financial crisis, the world has become much more interconnected and immensely more complex. As a result, you can no longer simply look at the past as an indicator of future trends.
The financial services industry needs real-time insights into numerous interacting variables to make informed decisions. Agent-based modeling can address this complexity by simulating the reaction of agents?virtual copies of people, banks, stocks, trading counterparties, or other autonomous entities?to a variety of environmental factors.
This white paper shows how new analytical platforms, such as Simudyne?s, combined with the power of the Cloudera modern data platform, can provide policymakers, regulators, and other key players in the financial services sector with the necessary tools to address these complex challenges.
coveo:metadata.title: Computational Simulation Whitepaper
10 Ways to Transform Big Data Analytics into Big Value

coveo:metadata.description: As necessary with any production system, there need to be multiple levels of replication and failure safes to ensure your data is protected and the system is fault-tolerant - even in the event of a disaster. In addition, many organizations still have a need for multiple clusters to handle site failure, geographic locality, and/or separate use case clusters. ?Active/Active? is a way to address these multi-cluster needs. Learn how Cloudera Enterprise lets you easily implement Active/Active multi-cluster deployments using the integrated, automated Backup and Disaster Recovery capability, available with Cloudera Manager.
coveo:metadata.title: Implementing Active/Active Multi-Cluster Deployments with Cloudera Enterprise

coveo:metadata.description:
The accelerating pace of technological change is considered by some to be the most creative and destructive force in finance (PWC), and the industry is facing great pressure to keep up.
In fact, 70% of financial services leaders state that the pace of technological change as a primary concern going forward, the percentage is even higher in banking at 81% (PWC).
12% of financial institutions not using artificial intelligence cited ?siloed data sets, fear of failure and unclear internal ownership of emerging technologies? as main factors thwarting innovation (Forbes).
So how will these forces for change and rapid technological advances affect the future of finance? What will be the big challenges facing institutions? What will the workforce of the future look like and what should business and IT leaders be doing right now?
In this report, we?ll be looking at the parts people and computers will play in the future of finance, how this relationship will evolve and what this means for financial institutions today and tomorrow.
coveo:metadata.title: The rise of machines

Ces forces perturbatrices commencent maintenant toucher le secteur de l'assurance. Mais combien de compagnies d'assurance sont rellement prtes pour faire face ces nouveaux dfis ?
Notre nouveau rapport fait le point sur l'impact des nouvelles tendances telles que l?IoT, le machine learning et la cyberscurit sur la donne et l?analytique au sein du secteur des assurances.
Les assureurs ont toujours t tributaires de donnes pour prendre des dcisions avises en matire de responsabilit et de risque. Mais ont-ils su s?adapter aux changements rapides qui touchent les donnes ? coveo:metadata.description:
Many retailers are trying to get a handle on the rapid evolution of how customers engage, purchase and make their buying decisions.
With customers being less loyal to specific retailers and spreading their purchases across brands it?s harder than ever to attract and retain an audience.
Competition is fierce but, in data, retailers have an opportunity to elevate consumer experiences in order to drive loyalty and attract new audiences.
We believe that a modern approach to data and analytics can enable retailers to deliver the right offers to the right people at the right time. And when 48% consumers spend more when their experience is personalised* why would you not take advantage?
Download this new white paper from our partner Cynozure to read how you can start being a more data driven organisation.

coveo:metadata.description: Being data-driven requires the ability to apply multiple analytics disciplines against data anywhere. To be able to process and stream real-time data from multiple endpoints at the edge, while predicting key outcomes and applying machine learning on that same data set. To be able to take advantage of public cloud infrastructure for its elasticity and self-service capabilities. And to be able to do all of this on an open platform, where consistent security and governance policies are applied everywhere the data lives and analytics run. This is what the industry calls an enterprise data cloud. Read the whitepaper to learn more about this emerging data management architecture.

coveo:metadata.description: Businesses today are moving to the cloud at unprecedented speeds. coveo:metadata.description: Data streaming and time-based reasoning applications are confronted with both simple and complex sets of challenges. coveo:metadata.title: Choose the Right Stream Processing Engine for Your Data Needs

coveo:metadata.description: The financial services industry will be transformed by cloud computing in five years. This seismic change will drive new innovations but concurrently introduce new types of risks that need to be addressed by regulators, the financial services industry and technology innovators. More regulators have begun to explore the topic of cloud concentration risk and are evaluating the potential operational and financial stability risks from the industry?s accelerating movement to the cloud. This whitepaper focuses on how global regulators are evaluating cloud related risks and how they might deal with these potential risks in the future, specifically the need to tackle the financial stability risks associated with cloud concentration risk.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloud concentration risk II: What has changed in the past two years?

coveo:metadata.description: This paper introduces you to key management components of Cloudera DataFlow (CDF)?s Streams Messaging capabilities, which are now also available within the Cloudera Data Platform (CDP). This materially advances how Kafka management, monitoring, and replication is done through two fully integrated components: Streams Messaging Manager and Streams Replication Manager. The Streams Messaging capabilities within CDP are available on-premises, on the public cloud as well as on hybrid cloud architectures. These address the unique needs of Kafka platform operations, DevOps, application development, security, and governance teams.
coveo:metadata.title: Manage, Monitor and Replicate Apache Kafka Across the Enterprise and Cloud with Cloudera Data Platform

coveo:metadata.description: As a result of providing excellent support to hundreds of customers on their advanced and large scale Kafka deployments, we?ve learned that it is not enough to just have the best messaging solution at the heart of your end-to-end streaming architecture. Flow management, along with stream processing and analytics, are two additional tenets that need to be unified with streams messaging capabilities. This paper describes how all three tenets are unified through a common data experience across on-premises, hybrid and multi-cloud environments. Through the integration of Cloudera DataFlow (CDF) with the Cloudera Data Platform (CDP) that leverages best-in-class, 100% open source based engineering, Cloudera delivers the best Kafka ecosystem today that ensures a sustainable, scalable and adaptable end-to-end streaming architecture.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Delivers the Best Kafka Ecosystem Today

coveo:metadata.description: The current global pandemic and associated societal unrest bring two important facts into stark relief. First, data and trust in data matters. It is the engine that forms both the ability to innovate and the capacity to withstand unanticipated change. Second, data, especially data residing on-premises, demands an underlying storage infrastructure that?s capable of accommodating a rich array of data, analytics, cloud-native, and artificial intelligence (AI) workloads securely and reliably at scale. In this whitepaper, Omdia analysts will help enterprise leaders understand how evolving market trends in data warehousing and processing, cloud-native development practices, and converged infrastructures can jointly transform legacy big data deployments into flexible, resilient engines of innovation fit for premises, edge, and beyond.
coveo:metadata.title: Omdia, IBM & Cloudera: Meeting the New Intelligent Data Economy Head-on

coveo:metadata.description:
JWG Is a pioneering market intelligence company working with firms, technologists, and regulators since 2006 to help the industry comply with the ever-changing regulatory landscape.?This research report draws conclusions from JWG?s February 2020 RegTech 2.0 conference with 250 market experts who discussed forthcoming challenges and defined strategies on how to get ahead of the curve. An expert panel on Infrastructure debated the impact of new technology on the risk footprint of the financial system and how well current policies help mitigate these risks under Chatham house rule.

"An explosion of advanced computing capability facilitated by Cloud technology has provided massive benefits to both regulated financial institutions and their regulators. However, it has also introduced new Systemic Technology Risks (STRs) to the financial sector.?Rapidly scalable technology and data enable powerful new business and supervisory models at far lower cost and faster deployment cycles. This enables supervisors to get hold of and interpret the vast quantity of information they receive daily on the safety of the system."
coveo:metadata.title: Risk Control for a Digitized Financial Sector: RegTech?s illumination of IT and data blind spots

coveo:metadata.title: Whitepaper: Three Key Factors for Gaining Control Over Your Data Lifecycle

coveo:metadata.description: Today?s data estates are growing in a scattered and complex way. The key to governing data is understanding its context, which encompasses what the data is and means, which audiences or stakeholders it is meant for, how it should be used, and whether there are any relevant internal policies and/or external regulations that apply to storing and consuming it. In this white paper you will learn about the challenges and gaps of governing and securing modern data lakes; how governance, security and access control are all tied to where the data is stored; and, effective approaches for finding context in your data lake that complement tools you may already have.
coveo:metadata.title: Analyst Whitepaper: Finding Context in Your Data Lake

coveo:metadata.keywords: Risk Modeling and Analysis,Whitepapers,Insurance,Education,Manufacturing,Smart Cities,Healthcare Analytics,Predictive Maintenance,Financial Services,Energy & Utilities,Healthcare & Life Sciences
coveo:metadata.description: What does the ideal platform for on-premises analytics look like? How would this platform minimize the delay, cost, and the stuttering cadence of so much on-premises analytics? In this whitepaper by IDG, we discuss how Cloudera and Red Hat can help you choose the right solution for your organisation and eliminate the five sources of delay in analytics running on traditionally configured hardware and storage.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera & Red Hat: Enterprise Analytics - Ideal vs Reality
coveo:metadata.useCase: Risk Modeling and Analysis|Smart Cities|Healthcare Analytics|Predictive Maintenance

coveo:metadata.product: Data Warehouse|Machine Learning|Cloudera Data Platform (CDP)|CDP Private Cloud
coveo:metadata.keywords: Churn Prevention & Customer Retention,Customer Experience Management,Data Warehouse,Machine Learning,Modernize Architecture,Cloudera Data Platform (CDP),CDP Private Cloud,Personalized & Relevancy Marketing
coveo:metadata.description: Insurers are being forced to face new trends that impact the way they engage with their customers. These trends involve digital, technological and social changes ? trends that continue to impact an organization?s ability to compete and survive in today?s competitive marketplace. This paper describes a more efficient customer journey for insurance carriers and some of the gaps and hurdles of better understanding the customer. It highlights critical steps and activities to help drive customer knowledge, increase customer satisfaction and grow profitable relationships.
coveo:metadata.title: The Journey to Understanding Your Insurance Customers
coveo:metadata.useCase: Churn Prevention & Customer Retention|Customer Experience Management|Modernize Architecture|Personalized & Relevancy Marketing

coveo:metadata.description:
The modern enterprise is on a collision course between the desire to capture data at an increasing rate and the ability to process that data. Gaining access to streaming data for immediate processing requires special skills. Developers and Analysts using Structured Query Language (SQL) can query such data once it has landed into a SQL-compatible store. Given the SQL skills? popularity across the industry over other specialized skills, it would be ideal to query real-time data with just SQL while it was still in the streaming system.

Read the whitepaper to learn how Cloudera SQL Stream Builder solves this problem by continuously running the SQL processes on the boundless stream of business data.
coveo:metadata.title: Modern Stream Processing using Streaming SQL

coveo:metadata.description: This article came out of a session that was run by Timur Nersesov on the PS team focused on a DoD audience. He talked about how "without good data you have no AI" and that competitive AI and ML depends on data availability and integrity, which means agencies must correctly prepare the data to be used by those algorithms.
coveo:metadata.title: Delivering Defense AI to the Edge

coveo:metadata.description: Created in conjunction with Fierce Software, this white paper highlights the public sector opportunity that has been brought with integrated Cloudera and Red Hat
coveo:metadata.title: The Integration between Cloudera Data Platform (CDP) and Red Hat Open Shift Platform (OCP)

coveo:metadata.description: Traditional data management and business intelligence is struggling under the pressures of increasing data volumes, new diverse data types, and a growing number of business users who need to make better data-driven decisions. Hadoop provides an affordable and scalable platform for storing, processing, and analyzing "big data", but it's just the beginning. Watch Datameer and Cloudera share what it takes to deliver successful analytic applications in the new world of big data. This webinar will address the following questions: What is Hadoop? What problems does it solve? How do leading organizations get the most out of Hadoop? How can you get started using Hadoop?
coveo:metadata.title: Delivering Insightful Analytics in a Data Driven World

coveo:metadata.description: There is an interesting clash of perspectives occurring in the enterprise market between the Hadoop newcomers and the old school data warehousing providers. The latter are attempting to paint Hadoop into a corner, narrowing its usefulness to a limited set of functionality while at the other end, the Hadoop providers are expanding the functionality of Hadoop to broaden its applicability and usefulness. In the middle are enterprises who are trying to figure out how Hadoop fits into their existing environment alongside data warehouses and other legacy systems. They are typically conservative and pragmatic and are primarily interested in reducing the cost of their environment while squeezing more value out of their data. In this recorded webinar you will hear in-depth panel discussion around this topic. Related topics discussed include: Understanding Hadoop?s role with respect to the data warehouse Economic considerations for Hadoop Panel speakers include Paul Miller - Founder, The Cloud of Data, Richard Winter - President, WinterCorp, Amy O'Connor - Sr. Director Analytics, Nokia, and Dr. Amr Awahdallah - Founder and CTO, Cloudera.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop vs EDWs: Trends in Enterprise Adoption

coveo:metadata.description: Tony Baer, Ovum Principal Analyst, shares insights from his recent whitepaper Hadoop: Extending Your Data Warehouse. Deploying Hadoop as part of the data warehouse infrastructure can help organizations dramatically reduce costs; improve quality of service for query, analytics, and reporting; and provide flexibility for tapping more data for business intelligence. Attend this webinar you will learn how, Hadoop offers an economical platform to offload data transformation cycles from the warehouse, and can potentially simplify and reduce errors in the process, Hadoop brings flexibility to enterprise analytics, and how Hadoop is rapidly adding capabilities - like interactive SQL - that make it easy for the business to adopt, while delivering the enterprise hardening that IT organizations require.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop: Extending Your Data Warehouse

coveo:metadata.description: Learn how Cloudera Search enables you to tap into the power of search for your Big Data. Cloudera Search brings full-text, interactive search and scalable indexing to data in HDFS and Apache HBase. Powered by and adding to Apache Solr, Cloudera Search fully integrates with CDH to bring scale and reliability for next-generation open source search — Big Data search.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Search Webinar: Big Data Search, Bigger Insights

coveo:metadata.description: At their core, YARN and MapReduce 2?s improvements separate cluster resource management capabilities from MapReduce-specific logic. YARN enables Hadoop to share resources dynamically between multiple parallel processing frameworks such as Cloudera Impala, allows more sensible and finer-grained resource configuration for better cluster utilization, and scales Hadoop to accommodate more and larger jobs.
coveo:metadata.title: Introduction to YARN and MapReduce 2

coveo:metadata.description: For organizations that need to be information driven while managing risk and cost, Apache Hadoop has emerged as the leading platform for Big Data management and analytics due to its flexibility, scalability, and economics. Yet the model of early adopters - implementing Hadoop as a special side project with dedicated expert teams - is not sustainable. In 2014, IT must look beyond the hype towards solving real business problems and make Big Data and Hadoop first-class citizens in the enterprise.
coveo:metadata.title: From Hadoop to the Enterprise Data Hub: A New Foundation for Modern Information Architecture

coveo:metadata.description: With the release of CDH 5.3, Cloudera announced the general availability of transparent encryption for HDFS, as well as HDFS integration with Apache Sentry (the open source standard for unified authorization for Hadoop) - both signify impressive progress for Project Rhino.
coveo:metadata.title: Project Rhino: Enhancing Data Protection for Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Limitless Data, Rapid Discovery, Powerful Insight What if your data stores were limitless and accessible? ?data discovery was fast? really fast? ?connectivity was so seamless you could almost take it for granted? And what if you could do all this with your preferred BI tool? Learn how to integrate Cloudera Enterprise with SAP Lumira via embedded connectivity from Simba Technologies.
coveo:metadata.title: How to Connect Cloudera to SAP Lumira with Simba

coveo:metadata.description: With the ability to store, process, and analyze unlimited data of any type, Hadoop has the power to enable businesses to leverage data like never before. For many enterprises though, the lack of critical capabilities limited what data could be stored, which users could access it, and how integrated it could become within existing systems. Cloudera has been focused on developing these key, enterprise capabilities in both CDH 5 (Cloudera?s open source Hadoop platform) and Cloudera Enterprise 5. With multiple releases since the initial launch of Cloudera 5, Cloudera has become the leading platform for production?ready Hadoop ? enabling the most customers across various industries to realize the true value of their data.
coveo:metadata.title: Changes in the Cloudera Hadoop Stack - CDH 5

coveo:metadata.description: RelayHealth, the healthcare technology solution segment of the Fortune 500 company McKesson Corporation, discusses how they used Cloudera as an Operational Data Store (ODS). This enabled them to drastically improve their data processing and storage allowing for increased efficiencies that drastically impacted their business.
coveo:metadata.title: RelayHealth Leverages More Data in Less Time

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera and Teradata discuss the best-in-class solution enabling companies to put data and analytics at the center of their strategy, achieve the highest forms of agility, while reducing the costs and complexity of their current environment.
coveo:metadata.title: Achieving Pervasive Analytics through Data & Analytic Centricity

coveo:metadata.description: As the adoption of Apache Hadoop continues to expand, it is being applied to more sensitive datasets in more compliance-oriented industries like Healthcare and Financial Services. These industries often include applications that needs to keep track of who?s accessing something or what they?re doing with it. While data governance isn?t a new discipline, data governance for Apache Hadoop presents a number of significant challenges due to data scale and flexibility. That doesn?t make it any less critical though, especially for enterprises storing sensitive data or industries needing to adhere to stringent compliance regulations.
coveo:metadata.title: Ensuring Big Data Governance & Compliance with Cloudera Navigator and Informatica

coveo:metadata.description: Experts from Cloudera and Syncsort cover: The Modern Operational Data Store ? What it is and why you need it The ETL Offload Framework ? Identifying, offloading and optimizing your workloads Success stories featuring organizations that have reduced costs and sped development with ETL offload to Hadoop
coveo:metadata.title: ETL on Hadoop: How to free up data warehouse capacity and budget to drive bigger insights

coveo:metadata.description: A Hadoop-based Enterprise Data Hub by Cloudera is quickly becoming the standard for storing and processing large amounts of data. Companies across industries are migrating to this technology, and the most sensitive data ? such as credit card numbers, social security numbers, etc - requires a degree of security that puts business leaders, regulators and customers at ease. Cloudera and MasterCard combined their respective experience of safeguarding sensitive transactional data with the science of securing and navigating Hadoop to produce the world?s first PCI-compliant Hadoop cluster. With that knowledge in hand, we have the best practices, processes, and technology to help guide your company in turning your most highly-sensitive data from a potential security liability into a strategic asset.
coveo:metadata.title: Guide Your Business Towards PCI Compliance

coveo:metadata.description: Global banks collectively paid more than $64 billion in penalties and fines in 2014, an increase of 30 percent from 2013. ?Human risk? such as insider fraud, rogue traders, regulatory and trading non-compliance breaches are now the biggest risk factors for financial institutions. With fragmented systems creating data silos and so many potential points of entry to monitor - email, documents, trading systems, call center, video, social media, web, mobile and other devices ? the need for Hadoop and cognitive analytics for Big Data is greater than ever.
coveo:metadata.title: Detecting Insider Threats and Human Risk with Hadoop and Cognitive Analytics for Big Data

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Navigator is part of Cloudera Enterprise?s comprehensive data security and governance offering and is a key part to meeting compliance and regulatory requirements. Through a single user interface, it provides visibility for administrators, data managers, data scientists, and analysts to secure, govern, and explore the large amounts of diverse data that land in Hadoop.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Navigator Demo

coveo:metadata.keywords: Technology,Videos,Enterprise Data Hub (EDH),Webinars,Video,Big Data,Analytics,Cloud,Customer Insights,Information Technology,Operations
coveo:metadata.description: Join Alex Gutow as she discusses real-time analytics and data in motion, self-service access for SQL analysts and data scientists alike, and public cloud and hybrid infrastructure.
coveo:metadata.title: Turning Data into Business Value with a Modern Data Platform

coveo:metadata.description: The cloud is becoming a popular choice for organizations running advanced analytics on big data. A few reasons for this include flexible deployments, elasticity for compute and storage, and the voluminous data already in the cloud and available for analytics. But even with the noted benefits, production big data clusters in the cloud still make up a small fraction of all big data deployments. This webinar will cover five key considerations and provide advice for enterprises looking to run production-scale big data environments on AWS.
coveo:metadata.title: Five Tips for Running Cloudera on AWS

coveo:metadata.description: Hadoop is complex software. As customers take on more powerful use cases, and deployments grow larger, delivering a superior support experience is about more than just reacting to tickets. Cloudera's support team learned early on to use data not only to quickly diagnose and resolve issues, but to predict and prevent them before they occur.
coveo:metadata.title: Data-Driven Customer Support

coveo:metadata.description: This webinar featuring experts from Cloudera and Tableau focuses on some of the challenges marketers face when trying to reach their intended targets with an effective message. Cloudera delivers a secure platform for unified data that helps marketing teams optimize campaign investments, create personalized experiences, and understand customer loyalty. Tableau is the fastest and easiest way to visualize your Hadoop data and start asking deeper questions about the effectiveness of your marketing campaign.
coveo:metadata.title: How Big Data Can Help Marketers Improve Customer Relationships

coveo:metadata.description: Big data in the cloud is no longer reserved for dev/test and POC environments. Today, leading organizations throughout the region are turning to Cloudera and Microsoft Azure to run production Hadoop workloads on public and hybrid clouds.
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera on Microsoft Azure

coveo:metadata.description: Inefficient data workloads are all too common across enterprises - causing costly delays, breakages, hard-to-maintain complexity, and ultimately lost productivity. For a typical enterprise with multiple data warehouses, thousands of reports, and hundreds of thousands of ETL jobs being executed every day, this loss of productivity is a real problem. Add to all of this the complex handwritten SQL queries, and there can be nearly a million queries executed every month that desperately need to be optimized, especially to take advantage of the benefits of Apache Hadoop. How can enterprises dig through their workloads and inefficiencies to easily see which are the best fit for Hadoop and what?s the fastest path to get there?
coveo:metadata.title: Unlock Hadoop Success with Cloudera Navigator Optimizer

coveo:metadata.description: With its popularity, development ease, and flexibility, Apache Spark has quickly emerged as an open standard in the Hadoop ecosystem and primed to become the next general processing layer for Hadoop. Cloudera recognized Spark?s potential early and has led the development effort to unite Spark and Hadoop into a cohesive, enterprise-grade platform. Cloudera has helped hundreds of customers get success with Spark and, with the release of Cloudera 5.5, we are further expanding the use cases and capabilities of Spark as part of a production platform. We have also worked closely with partners and customers, such as Capital One, to further enable data science use cases with Spark.
coveo:metadata.title: Hadoop for the Data Scientist: Spark in Cloudera 5.5

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Enterprise, dont le c?ur repose sur Apache Hadoop, vous permet de grer toutes vos donnes, avec une vritable plate-forme unifie, scurise, maitrise, administre et ouverte. Vous pouvez ainsi tirer parti des meilleures technologies ouvertes du march, tout en implmentant les fonctionnalits ncessaires pour rpondre aux besoins mtiers les plus sophistiqus. Regarder ce webinaire de 30 min, qui vous permettra de dcouvrir toutes les fonctionnalits avances de la plate-forme Cloudera pour l?entreprise.
coveo:metadata.title: Passer de Apache Hadoop une plate-forme d?entreprise - Webinaire en Replay

coveo:metadata.description: Organizations across diverse industries are in pursuit of Customer 360, by integrating customer information across multiple channels, systems, devices and products. Having a 360-degree view of the customer enables enterprises to improve the interaction experience, drive customer loyalty and improve retention. However delivering a true Customer 360 can be very challenging. Gain perspectives from industry experts at Cloudera about how organizations can utilize an Enterprise Data Hub, powered by Apache Hadoop, to effectively stitch together a true 360-degree view of their customers in order to deliver personalized offerings, improve marketing effectiveness and drive down churn.
coveo:metadata.title: Using Big Data to Drive a True Customer 360

coveo:metadata.description: SQL has become a staple in any enterprise, opening up data to users across many different departments and use cases. It?s no surprise that SQL access was quick to emerge within Hadoop technologies to make it easier to process and analyze the volumes of data being stored in Hadoop. Today, the Hadoop ecosystem is full of SQL-on-Hadoop technologies. However, while they may all have SQL in common, many of these tools are designed to address very different needs and use cases. In this webinar, we look at three SQL-on-Hadoop leaders available with the recent release of Cloudera 5.5 - Hive, Impala, and Spark - and how they are designed to complement each other to address use cases across the business.
coveo:metadata.title: Hive, Impala, and Spark, Oh My: SQL-on-Hadoop in Cloudera 5.5

coveo:metadata.description: Without the right data management strategy, investments in Internet of Things (IoT) can yield limited results. Apache Hadoop has emerged as a key architectural component that can help make sense of IoT data, enabling never before seen data products and solutions. Join us for this Cloudera webinar as we explore cross-industry trends driven by IoT, data architecture strategies for managing the sheer volume of data, and how to build comprehensive, secure solutions that will deliver immediate results. In this webinarVijay Raja, Solution Marketing Lead at Cloudera, will talk about the data explosion triggered by IoT and walks through the key segments and use cases for IoT today.Afterwards, Amy O'Connor, Big Data Evangelist at Cloudera, will introduce some of key attributes to look for in a data management platform for IoT, highlight a generic IoT reference architecture and walk thru some of the key IoT customer case studies.
coveo:metadata.title: Powering the Internet of Things with Apache Hadoop

coveo:metadata.description: Integrating Apache Spark, a cutting edge technology into your analytic ecosystem brings new challenges. In this webinar, speakers from Cloudera and from ThinkBig Analytics discuss the best practice in introducing Spark into your big data architecture: Guidelines for including Spark in your overall big data architecture and how to overcome common challenges for Spark adoption with data science users Spark examples and use cases captured from field engagements Strategies for measuring and proving business value from Spark engagements Three ?gotchas? for unsuspecting Spark users and how to avoid them
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Apache Spark into Your Big Data Architecture

coveo:metadata.description: Watch to learn about trends in the retail, manufacturing, and supply chain industries, how decision makers can apply new data sources, technologies, and methodologies to improve daily operations, how has Lineage Logistics implemented cold chain analytics to optimize efficiencies, and the role that Hadoop and Cloudera play in cold chain analytics.
coveo:metadata.title: Rethinking Supply Chain Analytics

coveo:metadata.description: As technology continues to advance and the world becomes hyper connected, organizations are facing massive cybersecurity challenges. Organizations have to determine what parts of their organization they want to protect in order to meet technology and budget constraints. It is time for a change.
coveo:metadata.title: Expert Panel: Cybersecurity in the Hyper Connected World

coveo:metadata.description: Are you struggling to validate the added costs of a Hadoop implementation? Are you struggling to manage your growing data? The costs of implementing Hadoop may be more beneficial than you anticipate. Dell and Intel recently commissioned a study with Forrester Research to determine the Total Economic Impact of the Dell | Cloudera Apache Hadoop Solution, accelerated by Intel. The study determined customers can see a 6-month payback when implementing the Dell | Cloudera solution.
coveo:metadata.title: Increase your ROI with Hadoop in 6 Months presented by Dell, Intel, and Cloudera

coveo:metadata.description: Today?s incessant need to unlock faster, deeper, and better big data insights has driven companies like Cox Automotive to develop a really effective enterprise data strategy. The adoption of Platfora and Cloudera has enabled the company to successfully tap into this target segment and overcome the traditional limitations of its existing data warehouse and business intelligence (BI) tools. Join this webinar to learn how Kelley Blue Book (KBB), a subsidiary of Cox Automotive, has maximized the value of existing advertising resources and revealed previously hidden relationships among KBB?s marketing campaigns, website engagement, onsite advertiser engagement, and revenue streams.
coveo:metadata.title: Kelley Blue Book Uses Big Data to Increase User Engagement Over 100%

coveo:metadata.description: Talend talks about their partnership with Cloudera
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Partner Insights - Talend

coveo:metadata.description: Informatica talks about their partnership with Cloudera
coveo:metadata.title: Cloudera Partner Insights - Informatica

coveo:metadata.description: When a company is hacked, and sensitive user data released without authorisation, it's clear that information security has been breached. However, companies may be willingly or unknowingly leaking information in non-obvious ways and the villain is also a hero of the big data era: data science. Applying data science to released data sets may discover latent information within that wasn't intended to be made public. In this webinar, we'll look at a few high-profile examples, discuss what went wrong and show how it could have been avoided. This webinar has been presented by Sean Owen, Director Data Science - Cloudera.
coveo:metadata.title: Fuzzy Data Leaks: How data science now challenges information security, and what we can do about it

coveo:metadata.description: Firms have become obsessed with data. But the key to competitive advantage is not just more or bigger data or big data technology, it is finding actionable insights from all the data as well as embedding insight in processes and applications. This requires a change in your approach - modernized architecture and embedding insights and data in you business decisions It also requires a change in how your people work systematically to find, test and implement insights. In this webinar, Forrester Vice President and Principal Analyst Brian Hopkins presents results from two years of research into the ideas of modernizing architecture and embedding insights and data in your business decisions, recommending how to get the most out of data and analytics to gain competitive advantage
coveo:metadata.title: Moving from data to insights: How to effectively drive business decisions and gain competitive advantage

coveo:metadata.description: Bidtellect is the leading native advertising technology and solutions company that helps connect advertisers with content publishers. Many times, it can be difficult to place the right ads at scale across multiple technology platforms?Bidtellect helps simplify this process. As Bidtellect has grown, so has the volume of data they manage. In the space of programmatic marketing, data is key to making the right decisions to drive the proper ad placement. As a result of these challenges, they were spending more and more money on data warehouse and BI services that didn't scale. However, this data is enormous ? volumes of genomic data are expected to reach two to four exabytes per year by 2025, yet the cost of genetic sequencing has decreased 100-fold over the past 10 years. Cloudera is helping solve the big data problem with its Apache Hadoop-based platform for large-scale data processing, discovery, and analytics; putting precision medicine within reach.
coveo:metadata.title: Reducing licensing costs by 70% while optimizing real-time ad placement

coveo:metadata.description: Financial firms are under pressure to grow their business while containing risk and complying with many regulations world-wide. In addition, there is the growing demand from customers to improve their experience and offer new services over multiple channels. Data is at the core of these capabilities but there are many challenges to overcome: fragmentation, security, quality, privacy, retention, to name a few.
coveo:metadata.title: Big Data as Competitive Advantage in Financial Services

coveo:metadata.description: As a #1 site in the highly transactional online offers market, Quotient (aka coupons.com) processes millions, and stores billions, of transactions daily. Immediate insight into what, when, and how those transactions take place is key to maintaining customer happiness and a competitive edge. How did Quotient innovate in the face of exploding data, while enhancing the value of existing investments in BI tools and skillsets? According to Eric Sit, Quotient?s Director of BI and Data Platforms, the key was starting a BI on Hadoop evolution.
coveo:metadata.title: How Quotient?s Big Data Leader Drove a BI on Hadoop Evolution

coveo:metadata.description: The emerging Industrial Internet of Things gives rise to what is predicted to be a sweeping change that will fundamentally reconfigure the IT industry. Vast amounts of useful sensor data will yield new business opportunities and competitors in nearly every corporation via analytics. However, all too often, sensor data is trapped in point solutions. The information required to enable breakthrough insights is fragmented within the domains of Information Technology and Operational Technology (OT). Further, organizations are realizing that analytics on sensor data is diverse and complex. Join us for this webinar to learn how leading companies harness the Internet of Things: - Putting IoT data in context - Fostering collaboration between IT and OT - Enabling a new breed of scalable analytics
coveo:metadata.title: When Big Data Meets the Internet of Things

coveo:metadata.description: Cloudera Enterprise can be used as an adaptive, high-performance analytic database, complementing existing data warehouses by relieving the pressure of growing numbers of ETL jobs and BI analytics. But where do you get started when developing your offload strategy? Cloudera Navigator Optimizer eases the path for moving the right workloads to Hadoop and then actively manages data allowing you to take advantage of Hadoop?s benefits. Now generally available with the recent release of Cloudera 5.8 and a unique part of Cloudera?s analytic database solution, Navigator Optimizer gives you the workload visibility and assessments to build a predictable offload plan, adapt to evolving data and workload demands, and optimize query performance for Hadoop technologies.
coveo:metadata.title: Introducing Cloudera Navigator Optimizer: Offload Assessments and Active Data Optimization for Hadoop Success

coveo:metadata.description: With more and more data being generated and stored in the cloud, you need a modern data platform that can extend to any environment so you can derive value from all your data. Cloudera Enterprise is the leading enterprise Hadoop platform for cloud deployments. It?s the easiest way to manage and secure Hadoop data across any cloud environment and includes component-level support for cloud-native object stores. This makes the platform uniquely suited to handle transient jobs like ETL and BI analytics, as well as persistent workloads like stream processing and advanced analytics.
coveo:metadata.title: High-Performance Analytics in the Cloud with Apache Impala

coveo:metadata.description: In this webinar, our guest, Forrester Vice President and Principal Analyst Brian Hopkins, presents results from two years of research into these ideas and recommend to attendees how they can get the most out of their data and analytics to drive effective business decisions and gain competitive advantage.
coveo:metadata.title: Moving from data to insights

coveo:metadata.description: Firms have become obsessed with data. But the key to competitive advantage is not just more or bigger data or big data technology, it is finding actionable insights from all the data as well as embedding insight in processes and applications. This requires a change in your approach - modernized architecture and embedding insights and data in your business decisions. It also requires a change in how your people work systematically to find, test and implement insights. In this webinar, our guest, Forrester Vice President and Principal Analyst Brian Hopkins, presents results from two years of research into these ideas and recommend to attendees how they can get the most out of their data and analytics to drive effective business decisions and gain competitive advantage.
coveo:metadata.title: APAC Webinar Wednesday - Moving from data to insights

coveo:metadata.description: Securonix co-founder and CTO Tanuj Gulati demonstrates how Securonix user and behavior entity analytics (UEBA) plus Cloudera?s next generation data and analytics management platform combine to deliver on the promise of big data security analytics. Securonix + Cloudera allows organizations to apply UEBA and machine learning to HR/identity information, active directory, and activity logs to detect compromised users accounts, insider threats, and other advanced persistent threats.
coveo:metadata.title: Delivering User Behavior Analytics at Apache Hadoop Scale

coveo:metadata.description: Capgemini?s Leap Data Transformation Framework helps clients by industrializing every aspect of transforming existing BI assets and capabilities to next generation big data management platforms. In this session, you will learn: - The key drivers to industrialize your transformation to big data at all stages of the lifecycle ? estimation, design, implementation and testing - How one of our largest client reduced the transition effort to modern data architecture by over 30% - How an end-to-end, fact-based transformation framework can deliver IT rationalization on top of Big Data architectures
coveo:metadata.title: Is your big data journey stalling? Take the Leap with Capgemini and Cloudera

coveo:metadata.description: As one of the largest and most successful auditing and consulting firms, PwC must constantly find the best ways to help clients manage risks and meet compliance obligations. Find out how they used Paxata and Cloudera to accelerate their analytics process along with lessons learned that can apply to your own organization?s data-to-information pipeline.
coveo:metadata.title: How PwC Transformed Their Analytics with A Modern Data-to-Information Pipeline

coveo:metadata.description: Join Securonix co-founder and CTO Tanuj Gulati as he demonstrates how Securonix user and behavior entity analytics (UEBA) plus Cloudera?s next generation data and analytics management platform combine to deliver on the promise of big data security analytics. Securonix + Cloudera allows organizations to apply UEBA and machine learning to HR/identity information, active directory, and activity logs to detect compromised users accounts, insider threats, and other advanced persistent threats.
coveo:metadata.title: Delivering User Behavior Analytics at Apache Hadoop Scale, a New Perspective on Cybersecurity with Securonix & Cloudera

coveo:metadata.description: One of the benefits of the Apache Hadoop ecosystem is the ability to choose the broad set of ecosystem components to efficiently meet the requirements of your use case. The availability of multiple frameworks gives users the ability to do real-time or batch processing with varied storage engines, efficiently handling your data along the way. However, when a use case requires a lambda architecture - a combination of speed and batch layers - the Hadoop ecosystem?s response has been to stitch together a complex hybrid architecture from its existing components. Cloudera has identified this gap, and plans to address it through Apache Kudu, the storage engine for fast analytics on fast data.
coveo:metadata.title: Moving Beyond Lambda Architectures with Apache Kudu

coveo:metadata.description: As organizations look at new ways to protect themselves from advanced adversaries, big data analytics continues to become a critical piece of a modern cybersecurity strategy. From inserting machine learning into processes to leveraging user behavior analytics, organizations require big data analytics to detect advanced threats in minutes. Join Rocky DeStefano, Cloudera Cybersecurity Subject Matter Expert, and Larry Ponemon, Founder of the Ponemon Institute, as they discuss recent studies of the current state of cybersecurity big data analytics.
coveo:metadata.title: 2016 Cybersecurity Analytics State of the Union

coveo:metadata.description:
Financial firms are under pressure to grow their business while containing risk and complying with many regulations world-wide. In addition, there is the growing demand from customers to improve their experience and offer new services over multiple channels.
We are going to hear about trends in the industry from IDC Financial Insights Research Director Bill Fearnley, followed by a discussion about how Cloudera has helped Transamerica turn their data into competitive advantage by creating an Enterprise Marketing and Analytics Engine.
coveo:metadata.title: APAC Cloudera Webinar Wednesday: Financial Services Webinar with IDC and Transamerica

coveo:metadata.description:
Data is the future of business. Either take advantage of it, or get surpassed by those who do.
In this webinar, Ovum's Tony Baer discusses the importance of building a modern data strategy that ensures your journey with Apache Hadoop and big data is a successful one. Together, we'll walk through how to build a plan for long-term success while realizing short-term gains.
coveo:metadata.title: APAC Cloudera Webinar Wednesday: Modernizing Architecture for a Complete Data Strategy

coveo:metadata.title: Teradata and Cloudera Executive Series - Faster Time to Value with the Teradata Appliance for Hadoop with Cloudera

coveo:metadata.description: "You have to put your data analytics where your data resides." Join Mike Olson, Co-founder and CSO of Cloudera and Oliver Ratzesberger, Executive VP and Chief Product Officer of Teradata on their views on the need of hybrid-cloud enabled data management platform.
coveo:metadata.title: Teradata and Cloudera Executive Series - Enabling the Hybrid Cloud

coveo:metadata.description: Analytics of things is not only changing the way organizations use data, but fundamentally change their business with data. Mike Olson, Co-founder and CSO of Cloudera and Oliver Ratzesberger, Executive VP and Chief Product Officer of Teradata talk about how we accelerate the analytics of things.
coveo:metadata.title: Teradata and Cloudera Executive Series - Accelerate the Analytics of Things

coveo:metadata.description: For many organizations, achieving regulatory compliance is challenging and time-consuming. To reduce the cost of compliance reporting, as well as optimize its efficiency, we need to go from point solutions to a more holistic approach that makes compliance part of the day-to-day business process.
coveo:metadata.title: Optimizing Regulatory Compliance with Big Data

coveo:metadata.title: Top 5 IoT Use Cases

  • How Sparklyr supports MLlib so data scientists can run classifiers, regressions, and many other machine learning algorithms in Spark.

This complex architecture was difficult to manage. Today, Apache Kudu offers the ability to collapse these two layers into a simplified storage engine.
coveo:metadata.title: Part 1: Lambda Architectures: Simplified by Apache Kudu Webinar

Now, by using Talend with Cloudera Enterprise, they are able to acheive a 9-10x performance benefit in processing data, reduce errors, and now provide more innovative products and services to end customers. Watch this webinar to learn how PRGX worked with Cloudera and Talend to create a high-performance computing platform for data analytics and discovery that rapidly allows them to process, model, and serve massive amount of structured and unstructured data.
coveo:metadata.title: Turning Petabytes of Data into Profit with Hadoop for the World?s Biggest Retailers

coveo:metadata.description:
While Public Sector technology demands often mirror many of those in the private sector, the outcome for government leaders remains focused on enhancing citizen services and providing security for constituents. Listen to this recorded webinar with Cloudera and Gartner to learn how a data driven government can cost effectively support the mission of your agency.

Key technology trends being embraced by government are explored in this webinar including multi-channel citizen engagement, the Internet of Things (IoT), the increasing use of analytics and more.

Cloudera and Gartner explore some of the top technology trends in government and how they are having the greatest impact on improving outcomes for the public sector.
coveo:metadata.title: Exploring Big Data Trends with Gartner: Technologies Impacting the Public Sector

coveo:metadata.title: Big Data Maturity Survey Webinar: Cloudera & Vivent
